qas.question: What year did the Black Death occur?
What caused ancient texts to be rediscovered by Byzantine scholars?
The invention of printing improved which society?

answers.text: a faster propagation of new ideas

qas.question: What type of mathematics aided in developing European science?

context: In <a0_0>1348<a0_0/>, the Black Death and other disasters sealed a sudden end to the previous period of massive philosophic and scientific development. Yet, the rediscovery of ancient texts was improved after <a1_0>the Fall of Constantinople in 1453<a1_0/>, when many Byzantine scholars had to seek refuge in the West. Meanwhile, the introduction of printing was to have great effect on <a2_0>European<a2_0/> society. The facilitated dissemination of the printed word democratized learning and allowed <a3_0>a faster propagation of new ideas<a3_0/>. New ideas also helped to influence the development of European science at this point: not least the introduction of <a4_0>Algebra<a4_0/>. These developments paved the way for the Scientific Revolution, which may also be understood as a resumption of the process of scientific inquiry, halted at the start of the Black Death.
